primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the 'Monday-morning side of resurrection' into the 'middle years' of suffering and social decay, where the believer seeks a manifestation of God's power to endure.

subject.identificatie: God (as the ultimate restorer) and the Believer (as the one praying/wrestling).
tekstueel_bewijs: He will give his angels charge over you

object.identificatie: Revival/Strength/Theodicy (Making God's ways intelligible and His power felt).

zender.identificatie: The Minor Prophets / Salvation History (The Cross and Resurrection).
tekstueel_bewijs: We have the pivotal events of our salvation history upon which our faith is founded

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / The Black Community / The Suffering Individual.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Faith / The 'Yes' of Resurrection.
tekstueel_bewijs: his spirit will cover the earth
the just shall live by faith

tegenstander.identificatie: Evil, Apartheid, Social Decay (Single-parent families, prison rates), and Death.
tekstueel_bewijs: the last enemy to be destroyed is death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but systemic injustice and the ontological reality of death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Ethical and financial obligations of the believer as a response to God's law.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher establishes the 'obligation' (Micah/Malachi) but pivots to the 'necessity of grace' (Habakkuk) when human strength fails.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Salvation History → Revival/Strength → The Suffering Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Resurrection Power → God ← Cosmic Evil/Social Decay

voorbeelden_god_subject: He will give his angels charge over you.
The Lord shall renew their strength.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I realized it was a mistake.
We have no choice except to trust.

voorbeelden: What doth the Lord require of thee
we have a vision of a world that might be
What is there to do when our own strength gives out?
He is able to stop it

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon moves from Devoir (obligation) to a crisis of Pouvoir (inability), concluding that only God possesses the Pouvoir-faire to revive the work.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Friday) to S1 (Sunday), then acknowledging the tension of ~S1 (the middle years) and calling for a return to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The 'Yes' of God in the Resurrection overrides the 'No' of human evil.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the preacher explicitly names systemic racism and social collapse.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon begins with moral requirements, it centers on human exhaustion and the necessity of God as the primary actor who 'revives' and 'stands by'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: our monetary duty, our fiscal duty, our financial obligation to God

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: What is there to do when our own strength gives out? ... ask him to give you strength.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Martin Luther King Jr. and Clarence Darrow are used, but primarily to show the 'residue' of faith or the weight of the struggle rather than simple 'be like them' moralism.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Habakkuk is not a hero of faith but a 'wrestler' who receives God's answer.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic revival; God must act for the church to survive.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Minor Prophets' as law-givers to Habakkuk as the seeker of grace is masterfully handled.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'we have no choice but to trust' (obligation) and 'when strength gives out' (inability).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the last enemy to be destroyed is death... he shall reign forever

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of Pouvoir (strength) to the weary.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is seen in systemic apartheid and the 'sinister coalition' of Calvary.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully shifts the Subject role from the 'marching' church to the 'reviving' God.

subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Maintain God as the subject of 'revive' and 'renew'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir in the introduction.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Ensure the 'tithe' and 'justice' requirements are explicitly grounded in the 'revival' power.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the ability to 'do justly' directly to the 'renewed strength' of the conclusion.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as systemic and cosmic.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already avoids trivializing evil.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The opening lists duties (Micah/Malachi) before the Gospel (Habakkuk/Romans).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of theocentric preaching that takes social reality seriously while keeping God as the primary Actant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'middle years' metaphor, Greimas reveals that the 'middle years' is actually a state of modal incompetence (lack of Pouvoir).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Habakkuk's context; semiotics explains how the preacher uses Habakkuk to re-assign the role of 'Hero' from the listener to God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: The 'Subject-Switch' at the point of exhaustion is the structural engine of the sermon's grace-orientation.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon uses the 'Minor Prophets' as a foil to move from Law to Gospel.
